title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to Sara A. Hotchkiss, January 11, 1863
summary: Hotchkiss describes life in a quiet camp on Sunday, the map of the battle of Fredericksburg that he made, and the state of the soldiers' supplies. He also gives brief instructions to his wife concerning their children and home.
keywords: Camp Life, Military Authority, Women, Church/Religious Activity, Family, Medicine/Hospitals, Home Front, American Civil War
